resources.string: Addition is bringing two or more numbers (or things) together to make a new total
Here 2 balls are added to 1 ball to make 3 balls
In Words : Two plus one equals three
Subtraction is taking one number away from another.
Your friend borrowed this red ball
Now you have green and blue ball
In Words : Three minus one equals two

Mathematics:

Each Right answer wins you one point.
You get 30 seconds to earn maximum points with right answers.

English:

You get one point on getting the right answer on your first attempt.

Note: Active Internet Connection is needed to update and upload your score.

Scores of Top 10 students will be published on leaderboard.

Multiplication is one of the four elementary mathematical operations of arithmetic, with the other ones being addition, subtraction and division.\nThe basic idea of multiplication is repeated addition.
In Words : Three times two equals six

Wittyape is a free self–driven learning management system that offers highly personalised and effective learning programs for classes 1 – 4 for CBSE, ICSE and other boards to help them learn by practice. The app and website provide multiple questions to learn and engage with their subject by solving interactive exercises to test their learning. Our products are carefully designed to ensure maximum learning through proven techniques such as adaptive learning.

PLEASE READ THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS CAREFULLY. BY USING THIS PLATFORM YOU AGREE TO BE BOUND BY ALL OF THE BELOW TERMS AND CONDITIONS AND PRIVACY POLICY.

1. Terms of Service

By choosing to visit and/or avail any Services provided by Wittyape, you agree to these Terms (as may be amended from time to time). Please read the following information carefully. If you are a parent or guardian and you provide your consent to your child's use of the Platform, you agree to be bound by these Terms in respect to their use of the Platform. By your continued access or use of the Platform, you signify your agreement to be legally bound by the Terms set forth herein. If you do not agree to the Terms of this agreement, promptly exit this platform and stop accessing the Services.

2. Description of Services

Wittyape facilitates online education services to children. We aim at providing lessons on Mathematics and English to the Child. The concept is to create a virtual classroom, which helps the Child to learn without any restrictions on time and place.
Wittyape will have its sets of modules according to which the Child is expected to complete their levels. Wittyape has lessons who will be assisting the Child with their modules.
However, for accessing the Services, the Child or You may have to create an account and disclose ("Personal Information") including
(i) name
(ii) e-mail ID
(iii) class

3. License to Use

Wittyape hereby grants You and the Child the limited right to access, view and use the Platform only for the purposes of accessing, viewing, or submitting User material. Company reserves the right to suspend or deny, in its sole discretion, your access to all or any portion of the Platform. This license is limited to personal and non-commercial uses by You and your Child. Any rights not expressly granted to You herein are reserved to Wittyape.

4. Intellectual Property Rights

Wittyape retains all rights (including copyrights, trademarks, patents, designs, logos, trade-dress, trade-secrets, know-how as well as any other intellectual property right) in relation to all information provided on or via this Platform (including but not limited to the curriculum taught, all texts, graphics, photos, illustrations, apps and logos). You shall not copy, publish, distribute or reproduce any of the information contained on this Platform or social media in any form without the prior written consent of Wittyape.

5. Intended Purpose of Use

Any application, code or content created using Wittyape’s platform are intended to be used solely as prototypes and for evaluation of validity and practicability of ideas. All such applications, codes and/or content may be solely created for educational purposes and gathering feedback by the students and are in no way fit for or meant to be used for any commercial use. Any other use of such apps, codes or content, other than the use specified herein is prohibited by Wittyape and the Wittyape shall not be liable for the same and you and your child shall indemnify Wittyape for any loss, claims or damages suffered by Wittyape in this regard.

Information We Collect and use

We collect information including
(i) name
(ii) e-mail ID
(iii) class

Purpose of Collection

We collect personal information only necessary for the following purposes:

1. To create and maintain an account;

2. To enable you to avail of our Services, and ensure efficient customer care experience and develop new features;

3. To determine the class of the Child and maintain his score in exercises.

Data Security

We always strive to keep your Personal Information safe, we have been taking many safety measures, including:

1. The security of your Personal Information is important to us, but please note that no method of transmission over the Internet, or method of electronic storage, is 100% secure. While we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your Personal Information, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

2. Safety in the operating environment: we store your Personal Information in a safe operating environment and it can only be accessed by employees, representatives and service providers on a need-to-use basis. We comply with industry standards and the law to protect your Personal Information.

The information contained in this platform is for general educational purposes only. We make no representations or warranties of any kind, about the completeness, accuracy, reliability, suitability or availability with respect to the application/website or the information, products, services, or related graphics contained on the application/website for any purpose. Any reliance you place on such information is therefore strictly at your own risk.\nIn no event will we be liable for any loss or damage including without limitation, indirect or consequential loss or damage, or any loss or damage whatsoever arising from loss of data or profits arising out of, or in connection with, the use of this application/website.

Enter the baby name of the animal:
Find the adjective in the sentence:
Identify the article in the sentence:
Write down the plural of the word:
Which letter is silent in the word:
Write the name of sound this animal makes:
Identify the verb in the sentence:
Identify words with degree of comparison:

Here’s a list of some baby animal names:

Cat - kitten
Tiger - cub
Deer - fawn
Chicken - chick
Dog - puppy
Duck - duckling
Lion - cub
Pig - piglet
Sheep - lamb
Monkey - infant

Antonym is a word opposite in meaning to another.

Here’s a list of a few antonyms-

Hot - Cold
Few - Many
East - West
Man - Woman
Win - Lose
Black - White
Question - Answer
Hard - Easy
Poor - Rich
Little - Big

A word that describes a noun or pronoun is an adjective.
In the sentence ‘This shop has the best samosas’, ‘best’ is an adjective.

Let’s see a few more examples of how adjectives are used in sentences.

The dog found a large bone.
large
She wore a beautiful dress.
beautiful
Shashi is a good man.
good
This glass is strong.
strong
This is a big box.
big
My job is worse than yours.
worse
Shashi is really clever.
clever
The doctor is late.
late
The house is bigger than other ones.
bigger
He is angry.
angry

"English has two articles: the and a/an. A/an is used to modify nouns, whereas the is used to refer to nouns.

Here’s how we use them in sentences:

Using - a

I need a book.
They bought a computer.
My friend has a pet dog.
She saw a movie last night.

Using - an

Shashi has an idea.
She ate an apple.
I eat an apple everyday.
He is an honest person.

Using - the

The Moon rotates around the Earth.
The sun is brighter than the Moon "

Plural denotes a quantity more than one.

Here’s a list of some few plural words:

Puppy - puppies
Tooth - teeth
Mouse - mice
Man - men
Woman - women
City - cities
Spy - spies
Baby - babies
Wolf - wolves
Knife - knives

A silent letter is a letter that does not correspond to any sound in the word's pronunciation.

Here are a few examples of words with their silent letters.

Knee - k
Two - w
Where - h
Nestle - t
Lamb - b
Bomb - b
School - h
Honest - h
Match - t
Listen - t

Here’s a list of a some other animal sound names.

Fox - yelp
Bull - bellow
Bee - buzz
Owl - hoot

Verbs are the action words in a sentence that describe what the subject is doing.

To help you understand with ease, we have identified verbs in the sentences.

The baby is playing with blocks.
playing
My mom cooks a yummy meal every day.
cooks
We began to climb the hill.
climb
She is drawing a picture
drawing
He writes his name on the desk.
writes
She ran across the garden.
ran
The Sun rises from the East.
rises
Birds build their nests.
build
They play with a ball.
play
The boy closed the door.
closed

Adjectives describe a quality or characteristic of a noun or pronoun. The basic form of an adjective is known as positive degree.
Adjectives can be changed to compare a quality between two nouns, this form is known as the comparative degree.
We can also change an adjective to identify a noun with the highest degree of an attribute among a group, this is known as the superlative degree.

Example of Positive to Comparative degree

Tall - more tall
Big - bigger
Small - smaller

Example of Positive to Superlative degree

Tall - tallest
Big - biggest
Small - smallest
